Education is core to our ambitions as a nation. It enables us to excel in science, culture and enterprise, and to break down cycles of disadvantage. That's why the investment provided in #Ireland2040 is so important.
We are investing ‚Ç¨2.2 billion in higher education infrastructure, including Public Private Partnership investment in 11 Institutes of Technology #Ireland2040
#Ireland2040 provides the investment needed to make the Irish education and training service the best in Europe
We will invest ‚Ç¨8.4 billion in primary and post primary schools, 50 large scale school projects annually with an additional 15,000 schools places annually #ireland2040

Roll out Springboard+2018, offering all courses to those in employment for the first time. As our economy continues to grow we will develop 25 new apprenticeships and 10 new traineeships #bestinEurope #EducationPlan18
Our critical skills are among the #BestinEurope and #EducationPlan18 will continue to receive support through the delivery of new and revised literacy and numeracy targets
The #EducationPlan18 will see the first ever In-School Speech and Language Therapy Service #BestinEurope

Ensuring the Wellbeing of our young people is a key priority of mine and I will provide more guidance to schools on the use of external providers, expand student support teams and continue to support the wellbeing programme for Junior Cycle #EducationPlan18 #BestinEurope
The enactment of the Technological Universities Bill will see the first TUs to open in September 2018 #EducationPlan18 #BestinEurope @mitchelloconnor
As we continue to break cycles of disadvantage I am developing a more tailored resource allocation model for DEIS schools. #EducationPlan18 #BestinEurope

Recognition of outside school initiatives at Junior Cycle, the development of new summer courses in STEM subjects and industry placements for teachers are all key actions. We must also continue to increase the uptake of students studying STEM subjects at Leaving Certificate https://t.co/3TFVL4HpQ8

Implement Computer Science at Leaving Certificate along with the School Excellence Fund ‚Äì Digital supporting schools in digital innovation. I am also progressing a new maths curriculum for primary schools with elements of coding #EducationPlan18 #BestinEurope
I believe it is essential we prepare for Brexit by creating a strategy to attract world-leading researchers to higher level institutions in Ireland post-Brexit #EducationPlan18 #BestinEurope
Implementation of foreign languages strategy to increase the number of students studying a foreign language at all levels or education. #EducationPlan18 #BestinEurope

The key actions of the 2018 Action Plan include: supporting schools clusters to undertake innovative projects and in deploying the recent investment of 3,000 extra posts of responsibility #EducationPlan18 #BestinEurope

The 2018 Action Plan will see continued progress in: school leadership, school excellence fund, STEM, Wellbeing, Digital Innovation, DEIS, special education, higher education, curriculum and assessment methods. #EducationPlan18 #BestinEurope

@campaignforleo @mitchelloconnor @JohnHalligan We must build on our achievements in Education where the Irish Education System has recently been shown to be the best in OECD countries in reading and maths. I believe the actions in the 2018 Action plan will ensure our Education system continues to build on this success

ICT funding can be spent on: Desktop PCs, laptops or tablets among other things, including projectors, cloud computing software or learning platforms
The ICT grant will allow schools to purchase ICT infrastructure that will align with the objectives set out in a school‚Äôs Digital Learning Plan
All schools have a Digital Learning Plan, outlining the integration of new technologies with the teaching and learning environment of the school.

Schools will receive grants of up to ‚Ç¨33,000 to purchase key enabling technology including tablets, cloud technology and projectors. We must ensure our young people have access to the technologies needed to encourage critical, creative thinking and problem solving skills
As internet safety week begins, I am investing ‚Ç¨30m in ICT equipment for schools. Digital technology can transform the way people learn, encouraging curiosity, exploration and creative thinking.

Presented the silver medals to very worthy recipients of the @IrelandSkills awards ceremony today. Thank you for the commemoration celebrating 60 Years membership of @WorldSkills and my very own replica of my seal of office https://t.co/CWXNUV9NB4
I'll be on @LunchtimeLiveNT shortly discussing today's announcement to ease pressures for schools finding subs and teachers for certain subjects
Speaking to the media after my @IPPN_Education speech today https://t.co/8z5L6qzbmy
You can read my full announcement regarding teacher supply issues here  https://t.co/uzpJfb0JAC
I am keen that in approaching this issue that we can work with all stakeholders in the best interests of schools and learners.
I will shortly be announcing the establishment of a Teacher Supply Steering Group to consider teacher supply issues at primary and post primary.
The increase in the number of places available on these undergraduate teacher training courses needs to start immediately in critical subject areas.

The undergraduate route to becoming a second level teacher is a very good option for students as it is shorter and less expensive. 5,300 people applied for this adoption last year. I want to double the number of places available.
We are considering how to introduce subject quotas, targeted at areas of shortage, for those undertaking the second level PME

This is not a sustainable approach in the context of our ambitions in STEM, in foreign languages and in digital, and in the context of my overall ambition to have the best education and training service in Europe.
This has not generally been the case at second level where higher education institutions have had autonomy to decide on the enrolment of students seeking to become second level teachers.
Since the foundation of the state my Department has managed teacher supply at primary level. We have controlled the number of courses and the number of places in publicly funded HEIs.
Career break is meant to facilitate personal development, voluntary service overseas, childcare or self-employment.
Purpose of the career break is not to facilitate someone taking another fulltime job, while retaining the right to return to their former teaching job at any point for up to 5 years.
My Department will also issue a note to schools today emphasising that a career break should not be granted unless the school is in a position to fill the temporary vacancy that would be created.

I am today suspending the restrictions regarding substitution limits for those on a career break.  This is a temporary measure which we will keep under review to help schools finding it difficult to find substitutes.
Since 2012/2013, there are 8,900 more teachers working in our schools. No other part of the public service has seen this sort of employment growth in recent years.
I'll be on @morningireland just after 8 speaking ahead of my speech at @IPPN_Education conference
People with jobs will now be eligible for free third level courses https://t.co/8MdtMXjy6Q
All Higher Education providers can submit their proposals for Springboard+ courses here https://t.co/uHZ2Ku2hJq
This change reflects this government's commitment to life long learning and supporting people to continue their education throughout their career
Level 6 courses will continue to be free to all people in receipt of certain allowances, including Jobseekers Benefit
This year for the first time, all Springboard+ courses will be open to everyone irrespective of their employment status.

Springboard+ offers fantastic opportunites for people to upskill or reskill throughout their careers, with courses paid either in full or 90% by the government. 47,000 free higher ed places have been provided to date
Today with @JohnHalligan I am announcing another call for new Springboard+ courses

I was also pleased to negotiate a 15-22% pay increase for new teachers. A teacher graduating this year will start on a salary of nearly ‚Ç¨36,000. By October 2020, a graduate will start on over ‚Ç¨37,600
The numbers graduating from teacher training courses has remained steady over the past few years - this year, nearly 3,500 teachers will graduate from teacher training courses in 2018

Teaching is a very attractive, highly respected career option. We recently announced 3,000 promotional opportunities in schools. These new opportunities will mean that 1 in 3 teachers will now be in leadership positions in our schools

We are very fortunate to have fantastic teachers in Ireland. I'm delighted that more teachers are now staying in Ireland upon graduating than in previous years (73% of undergrads compared to 59% in 2013)

I also accept that some schools are finding it challenging to find teachers in certain subjects. The reasons for this are complex. I have taken some steps already (e.g. expanding the no of places on the Home Ec prog in St. Angela's) & will announce further measures shortly
I've already taken some steps to alleviate pressure on schools such as ensuring, in as far as is possible, that as many retiring and retired teachers remain on the Teaching Council register

I accept some primary schools are experiencing issues with substitution - there are strong career opportunities in teaching & the no of permanent full-time positions are currently increasing at over 1,000 per year - availability of these permanent jobs makes subs less attractive
This reflects the huge emphasis this Government puts on education
8,900 new teaching positions have been created since 2012 - my Department is creating more new teaching positions than at any other period in the history of the state

We have stepped up our recruitment of teachers. Over 5,000 extra teachers (net) have been hired since I was appointed Minister, almost 2,400 in primary schools and just over 2,850 in post primary schools
Will be on @TodaySOR shortly to discuss our review of Career Guidance in schools, universities & further ed and other education matters https://t.co/4xuHgaxD1U
This review will ensure the broader community is proving high quality career guidance support to the next generation
We are fortunate our children have excellent role models, access to exciting emerging sectors and opportunities such as transition year work experience
Employer, higher education institutions, employers and public service providers all have an interest in ensuring our children make good career choices
We've restored 500 guidance posts in schools, but ensuring the next generation make good career choices involves the wider community
We need to ensure that we are providing high quality, relevant career guidance to all students from when they are in school right up to further and higher education
I'm conducting a review of career guidance in schools, universities, IOTs and colleges of further education: https://t.co/TpvBaxOmx6

We must become more climate conscious in the way we live our lives, right down to the little things such as drinking a cup of coffee. I would like to support @yfg on-going #UseYourOwn campaign to urge people to use reusable travel mugs https://t.co/pCgkk1n9n6

To achieve my ambition of having the best Education and Training Service in Europe we must create the best pathways for our students to fulfil their career ambitions and also ensure our education system is equipped to meet the skills needs of enterprise

@itcarlow It is important to listen to people at a local level to hear what we are doing well and what we need to do to achieve my ambition to make our Education and Training Service the best in Europe

In @itcarlow to discuss my  Action Plan for Education on Meeting the Needs of Students and the Skills Needs for Work and Enterprise with local representatives from the education and enterprise sectors https://t.co/8iBb6eH78Z

On @kclr96fm now to discuss the Action Plan on Education panel discussion we're having in Carlow IT this morning on how we can build a better bridge between enterprise and education @PatDeeringTD @JPPhelan
The hundreds of new positions being announced today will mean that one in three teachers will be in promoted positions in our schools.

Delighted to announce new promotional opportunities for teachers today. 1300 new leadership posts in post primary schools will build on 1300 new posts at primary. Key changes include the phasing out of seniority as a stand alone criterion for selection.

The changes to the leadership structure in our post primary schools announced today include: 1,300 extra posts for leadership, creating leadership teams in schools and the provision for reporting and regular review.

Today I announced changes to the leadership structure in our schools. The biggest influence on our school going children is the quality of their teachers and the leadership within their school. I have set ambitious targets to improve areas such as: literacy, numeracy, technology

A new funding formula which we are announcing today will link third level funding to the delivery of key national goals, including key skills provision, increasing performance, innovation and lifelong learning
Chairing a meeting of the National Skills Council this morning. https://t.co/j9BRSKeOUo
Upon meeting the criteria additional funding of ‚Ç¨250,000 will be provided to multi campus institutions

This will ensure innovation, good governance and excellent research are prioritised by our institutions. These reforms will provide clarity on the expected outcomes for higher education over the next three years and on how funding will be allocated to our institutions

The new competitive fund for innovation will provide extra funding for multi-campus higher education institutes. The funding will be linked to the delivery of key national priorities. I believe we must introduce new performance-based mechanisms for improved outcomes.
Visited the history exhibition of Coolock in Coolock Library well worth a visit https://t.co/I0HAgxeRRK

Following the launch of the ESRI evaluation of the PLC programme I welcome the commitment by SOLAS to implement over 40 of its recommendations including: allocating 500 PLC places nationally to new pre-apprenticeship courses, ETB led co-ordination at a local level on provision

Clusters will report on the impact of their projects on participating schools and then consider how that learning can be disseminated to all schools.
2/2 4. The cluster co-ordinator will receive up to 2 hours per week paid substitution cover for work on the project 5. Online support and training

1/2It is expected each cluster will work on their project over the course of three years. The following resources will be given to each cluster: 1. An average grant of ‚Ç¨30k 2. Paid subsitution cover for networking/training/showcase events 3. Support from the cluster co-ordinator
Clusters may be made up of 4 and 6 schools, however my Department will consider larger clusters depending on the project. Clusters can be made up of all primary, all secondary or a mixture of both

The ability of our education system to adapt to an economy and society transformed by digital learning is key to my ambition to make Ireland's Education and Training Service the best in Europe by 2026

Schools in an established cluster with a project proposal and a lead school identified or individual schools indicating a clear area of interest and clusters of schools sharing the same interest are open to apply
I would like to invite all schools to apply to become part of clusters of schools, working together on innovative projects in teaching and learning using digital technologies
